Interface FilterPipelineInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
FilterManager
public interface FilterPipelineInterface
The FilterPipelineInterface interface defines the operations for managing a filter pipeline. Implementing classes must provide mechanisms to add, remove, and execute filters on images, as well as retrieve the current size of the pipeline.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addFilter(FilterCommand filterStrategy)
    Adds a filter to the end of the filter pipeline.
    void
    addFilter(FilterCommand filterStrategy, int index)
    Adds a filter at a specific index in the filter pipeline.
    void
    executePipeline(WritableImage image)
    Executes the filter pipeline on the given image.
    int
    getSize()
    Retrieves the current number of filters in the filter pipeline.
    String
    remove(int index)
    Removes a filter from the filter pipeline at a specific index.

  • Method Details

    • addFilter

      void addFilter(FilterCommand filterStrategy)
      Adds a filter to the end of the filter pipeline.
      Parameters:
      filterStrategy - the filter to add, represented as a FilterCommand.

    • addFilter

      void addFilter(FilterCommand filterStrategy, int index)
      Adds a filter at a specific index in the filter pipeline.
      Parameters:
      filterStrategy - the filter to add, represented as a FilterCommand.
      index - the position in the pipeline where the filter should be added.

    • remove

      String remove(int index)
      Removes a filter from the filter pipeline at a specific index.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the filter to remove.
      Returns:
      the name of the removed filter.

    • executePipeline

      void executePipeline(WritableImage image)
      Executes the filter pipeline on the given image.
      Parameters:
      image - the ImageBusinessInterface representing the image to process.

    • getSize

      int getSize()
      Retrieves the current number of filters in the filter pipeline.
      Returns:
      the number of filters in the pipeline.
